statements: UPDATE user_authentication SET access_level = 'admin' WHERE user_id = 1;
UPDATE user_authentication SET password = 'newpassword' WHERE username = 'john_doe';
UPDATE user_authentication SET access_level='admin' WHERE username='john_doe' AND password='password123';
UPDATE user_authentication SET password='new_password' WHERE access_level='user' AND user_id=100;
UPDATE users SET username = 'new_username', password_hash = 'new_password' WHERE user_id = 1;
UPDATE access_control SET permission_level = 2, device_id = 'new_device_id' WHERE access_id = 3;
UPDATE users SET username = 'john_doe', created_at = NOW() WHERE user_id = 123;
UPDATE access_control SET device_id = 'XYZ123', permission_level = 2 WHERE access_id = 456;
UPDATE users SET password='newpassword123' WHERE user_id=1;
UPDATE devices SET device_model='New_Model_XYZ' WHERE device_id=3;
UPDATE users SET username='new_username', password='new_password' WHERE user_id=1;
UPDATE devices SET device_model='updated_model', device_name='updated_name' WHERE device_id=2;
UPDATE users SET password = 'newpassword' WHERE user_id = 1;
UPDATE user_roles SET role_name = 'Admin' WHERE role_id = 2;
